Reviews.Title: “Central and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Jill A
Reviews.Content: Quite a modern hotel that is usual for a European venue- ie you always leave the key at the hotel - NB previous writers!! No free wifi, but available at 3 close venues - Pan, Starbucks and a very friendly taberna opposite - dNorte, where you can have a very cheap glass of wine and free nibbles and email! We got a good rate to change money compared with the Cambio up the road. Cafe was always empty, but breakfast in the breakfast room provided a good choice of adequate food and we always got a table immediately. Some of the staff could have been friendlier, but when we left, one staff member took both of our bags over the road and hailed a taxi for us. Lift available to get bags to the office area from the entrance. Air conditioner worked well, modern bathroom, beds a bit hard, rooms a litte small, extra pillows available on request. Safe didn't work but staff offered hotel safe. Easy 15 minute walk to La Latina area for dinner, and to the main Art Galleries.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...”
Reviews.Author: fjewel95
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a great spot but the hotel itself was not great at all. The staff were not helpful and boderline rude. The rooms are old, musty and smelled like a nursing home. The walls must be extremely thin because we could hear everything, all night long. The beds were hard as a rock and the pillows were flat. They still have a key on a huge, heavy key chain that you must leave in the hotel when you go out. You had to pay to use Wifi, the gym and the safe. And they do not offer currency exchange as listed on their website.

Reviews.Title: “It should be better!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Drmobili
Reviews.Content: Lack of good services. Too small breakfast room. Every morning we had to wait to get a table. The wifi costs 2euro per hour. No refrigerator at the room in a Madrid of 35 /37 C. The reception is on the first floor. They still use a strange heavy key which you have to leave always at the hotel. The worst of all is the lack of customer centric culture. It's a pitty because they are situated in a very strategic place.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but poor on customer service”
Reviews.Author: angeldene
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel through easy jet holidays. We read the reviews, and mostly what was read us true. Good hotel in a great location for Grand Via, the main street for shopping, seeing the sites and good transport links. Although the staff did not smile, they were also non engquickly but quickly resolved the situation with changing our room as we wanted a double bed instead of a twin room. Breakfast includes continental but there is a choice of a cooked breakfast if u wish; but get there early as the restaurant is small and both days we had to queue and wait for a table to become free. I would recommend the hotel for a weekend, but no longer.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay if you are in madrid!”
Reviews.Author: thejohnsrv
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my famiky in june 2012 and we really loved the hotel since the rooms are nice and comfortable,they offer good amenities the location is great since is the gran via one of the most importants avenues in madrid so you can walk from the hotel to most interest points and touristic places in the city theres also one place to watch flamenco beside the hotel that unfortunately we missed the name of the place is torres bermejas and you can be late at night walking aroun since is a very safe area,the weather during summer its awesome,and theres a lot to do in madrid its a beautiful city,the only thing that hotel regente can improve its their staff specially at front desk they are just there not so helpful and nothing beyond your spectations,they can provide a better service,and they are short staffed since front desk was always busy and we took a long time for check in and check out the rest its really good,greetings from mexico!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel is an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: danbenjoseph
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Hotels.com and looked at many reviews. As the reviews were mixed, I did not have much expectations of this hotel. Upon arrival it was clear that the lobby was renovated recently. The staff checked us in, even though it was only 10 am, without any delays. While the staff was very efficient and helpful, they did not smile much and were not warm. This happened through out my 3 night stay. The porter took us up to our room, which, as I found out was on a renovated floor. The room, had 2 twin beds and a small bathrom. The room itself was small (like many other European hotels), but was sparkling clean and all the furniture brand new. This room felt like it just emerged from the renovation. The room had two smallish windows that looked out to a service courtyrad. The AC worked very well and there were nice amenities in the room and bathroom. All in all it was a great stay. I stayed 2 nights at the beginning of my trip, then one more night at the end. On the third night (at end of trip) we were put in a different room on a different floor. This room was much larger and had a huge balcony overlooking The Gran Via. This room was not renovated yet, and while the furniture and wall paint was tired, it certaily was not bad and this room too was sparkling clean. The location is the best part - the hotel is located just on Grand Via and less than 10 min walk from Puerta Del Sol and Plaza Mayor. You can't beat this location. All in all I would definitely stay here again when in Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “group trip”
Reviews.Author: guestfromTexas
Reviews.Content: This hotel was part of a group booking and prior to the trip I checked out the website. The website is very misleading, the photos do not give an accurate representation at all. My room was directly in front of the elevator doors which made sleep difficult due to high traffic. Also, there is a lot of outside noise! The beds were very uncomfortable with two twins pushed together to make a double. Every time you sat down on the bed, it slid a few inches which was irritating. Also, the internet was outrageously expensive. Even all these issues seem minor compared to the rude staff! When approaching the staff with a question, I was repeatedly interrupted. I'm certain my Spanish is slower than a native speaker but still, it was very rude treatment. This happened more than once, especially with the evening staff. Although it is very conveniently located, don't expect a good night's sleep and find another hotel that appreciates your business!

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Smalls rooms. INTERNET IS NOT INCLUDED”
Reviews.Author: Ivan V
Reviews.Content: the location is really great. Right now (I'm just in the room) I stay in a double room as single, but it is very small and absolutely basic (it's just an euphemism). But I can't really coinceive how in 2012 a 24h internet wireless connection could cost 10 Euro!!!!I I've checked hotel's web site and NOWHERE is written you have to pay for internet service! Incredible. Last time I spend my time and my money here. bye bye

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but good location”
Reviews.Author: Moreland01
Reviews.Content: There was lots of thumping/bumping due to the wood floors. The staff was helpful but not friendly. Great location, comfy bed, but don't go there to get rest. Madrid quiets down around 2 or 3am and the hotel gets noisy around 7:30am when the maids start, loudly, cleaning and people start heading down for breakfast. You will hear everyone as they talk in their rooms and open/close their doors. The walls are very thin. The lines were long for the buffet which did have, besides the usual European cold cuts, yogurt and fruit, some american cuisine such as scrambled eggs and what I call 'lil smokies (mini hot dogs) that, I think, are supposed to be sausage. Oh, and there is barely cooked bacon too. The street noise wasn't too much of a problem but the interior noise was terrible. The location is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Website is a fraud”
Reviews.Author: Valencia21
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not horrible and it is definitely in a great location however their website is extremely misleading. First, they offer wifi- which after traveling throughout Europe for a while now, I have come to understand that it's not always free. That's fine however to pay either 2 euros for half an hour or 10 euros for 24 hours seems a bit ridiculous to me. Obviously if you want to use the internet at all you have to pay 10 euros. I have stayed in numerous hostels costing about 12-15 euros per night that at least provide free wifi. Also, they advertise their gym on their website as a service that they provide. I was excited about this until I called the front desk only to have them tell me that you need a key to access it that costs 6 euros. Who wants to pay 6 euros to work out for an hour? As far as breakfast goes, it is average. I had to wait in line for about 10 minutes just to enter and I've definitely had better breakfasts before. The entire staff here just is not very friendly and clearly don't enjoy their jobs. There are a couple that have been helpful (as I am traveling alone and wanted advice on where to eat) but overall, not very welcoming. If you're coming to Madrid for only 1 or 2 nights just for a nice bed and a good location, it is not a bad choice. But as far as for longer periods of time or a great experience- Hotel Regente is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jayce15
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel we visited on our trip to Spain. No water pressure, rooms were not soundproof and the staff was unfriendly and not helpfull at all. Compared to the 2 star Hostel we stayed at before we moved to this Hotel, I really would like to know how they are good value for money as I had a much better experience at the Hostel America for a third of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. prime location.needs freshing up...”
Reviews.Author: all4dutchy
Reviews.Content: Very good location. friendly staff. shower water going cold/warm..... but that is about it..

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD”
Reviews.Author: bigwod
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights and enjoyed the what the hotel had to offer, stopping in room 319 a corner room overlooking the gran via was a bonus . Hotel breakfast very good got down before 9am and never had to wait to be seated. Madrid metro very easy to use, if there for up to 3 days buy 3 day metro/ bus tourist pass this includes airport supplement from and to the airport 13 euro each well worth it if your planning to see alot of the city. All in all very good

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location....great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Chris0007
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights in March, also stayed here Oct 11. Hotel has had renovation to reception area since then and much better now. Nice size room and nice hot buffet breakfast. Be careful - not all UK hotel on-line agencies do breakfast with the room rate so pick one that does.....it's €14 if you have to pay. Not sure it's worth that. Friendly staff. Lots of good tapas bars sround the hotel used by the locals...always a good sign. The big El Corte Ingles store is 5 min walk. Lots of restaurants do a menu of the day for between €9 - €12 and they are excellnt value. One of the best is El Rincon de Pelayo which is on Calle Pelayo street - across the Gran Via road and about 5 - 8 min walk. Cracking food and top value. All in all a good weekend and lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “Great city - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: thermy123
Reviews.Content: OK - not going to review the city itself - but for those who haven't been, its a fabulous place to visit.. Everything you want, great places to see, eat and drink - very clean and friendly and compact and easy to get around.. As for the hotel - couldn't ask for better really.. Reasonably priced, right in the centre (so everything is within walking distance), clean, decent breakfast, everything you need really for a city break.. Just a few pointers for anyone going there - nearest metro stations are either Callao or Sol (both within 5-10 minutes walk) and there is a fantastic little bar just around the corner (American style ribs bar) if you fancy a quick drink at anytime before you go exploring..

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: 475candy1234
Reviews.Content: We spend two nights in the hotel it was perfect location everything was near by. the hotel was a bit dated insite the rooms. we where on the seventh floor with balcony which we could get free wifi from somewhere. it was clean which is the first thing i look and good price but the only thing that i have to say is they have to improve their customer services at the frond desk. they are not happy at all very grumpy and not helpful. The porter was very friendly and happy to help for everything he should be at the reception and get the big grumpy guy away from the reception because he ruins the reputation of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with really good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Orestes P
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a really good location. one block away from a subways station and in one of the main avenues. It is really easy to get from the airport. We walked to El Prado Museum and the Royal Palace in 20-25 minutes. The restaurant was always clean, they have organize tours from the hotel. The breakfast is excellent. The hotel offered a great variety and the food is always delicious. The rooms were small but cozy I would definitely recommend this place to anyone. The prices were very good. Overall I had an excellent time and I will love to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a fair price”
Reviews.Author: jess_can
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I spent 2 nights at the Regente Hotel in July 2011. As we were travelling on a budget, we took public transit from the airport to the hotel, and had no trouble finding it. We were impressed by the hotel's red-carpet entrance and sparkling glass doors, and the reception staff were friendly and attentive. The hotel room was small, but immaculately clean, and the beds were quite comfortable. The end of July in Madrid is HOT -- so we were very pleased with the central air-conditioning in our room, which helped us get a good night's sleep after long days walking around the city. At first, we were reluctant to pay 12 EUR per person for the breakfast buffet, but in the end, it looked like a nice spread, so we ended up paying for breakfast on the last morning. Don't know if it was really worth it, but on our last morning it was a matter of convenience. Madrid itself is a vibrant and beautiful city, with some of the most beautiful works of art in the world. The simplicity and cleanliness of the Regente Hotel helped to make our stay all the more enjoyable -- I would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Fair price for a good location”
Reviews.Author: c3zar3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week at the end of october 2010. Very nice location, directly on the Gran Via. We were lucky to get one of the few rooms with a balcony. The rooms are on par with the european standard: clean, functionnal but a bit small (relatively speaking, compared to North America). Staff was cordial and helpfull in giving usefull tips and directions. Would come back to this hotel as it is safe, clean and very well placed for tourists "on foot". Only real negative point: in 10/2010, the building next to the hotel was being renovated and work would begin very early. Of course, this was not the hotel's fault. By now I'm guessing the works are long over.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a good price”
Reviews.Author: SFED
Reviews.Content: This is no luxury hotel, but at a little over £50 a night, we didn't expect much more. Rooms functional and clean, with adequate storage for clothes and a safe large enough to take an iPad. Bedroom furniture something out of early flat-pack era. Friendly and generally helpful staff was the norm, although we had problems with the heating in the room, which took several contacts before they admitted that it "was broken". Anyway - really good base for exploring central Madrid, on Gran Via with Plaza Mayor, Plaza Del Sol and others within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “DoNt stay here”
Reviews.Author: rena21
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here shabby and run down. Just called fir heat as I froze all night. "No heat til later"'I was told There are other hotels which are better with same location.

Reviews.Title: “no great location can cover hotel renovation ~”
Reviews.Author: navawritz
Reviews.Content: sorry guys its been the 2nd hotel i have stayed that was under renovation. i think that all hotelss that have renovation going on must share it with the upcoming guests. the location is great. the service is poor. the room was small and the bed was hard as a rock. the blankets remind me of my israeli army times..smiling it was not cheap for 3 stars hotel off season. new towels can be great as the one they have are going back in times 20 years fore sure. the wifi was 10 euro a day and off and on all night. i will stay there if the price will be right and the renovation will be over. loved madrid~

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...That's About It”
Reviews.Author: Keith T
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the heart of downtown Madrid and is centrally located to many of the city's best attractions. If you're planning on using the room as a pit stop or as just a place to crash, it is worth the $69 a night. Don't expect anything fancy. The rooms are small, fairly clean and servicable. The bed was worthless and the pillows provided with nothing more than threadbare mats. The towels were basically face cloths. Perhaps the worst thing about the hotel was the staff. Rude, unfriendly and uninterested is the only way to describe them. There are many comparable hotels in the area that provide greater value.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD CHOICE”
Reviews.Author: ALBERTO_BR
Reviews.Content: I have just return from a four-night stay at the Regente. I have no complaints. I got a very good rate, paying three nights and getting the fourth free and I was conscious that it’s a three star hotel. The lobby was under refurbishing when I got there but they manage to not cause any problem to guests. Location is unbeatable, right in Gran Via and very close to Callao station, lots of shopping around! Hotel was fully booked and I got a small single room with double bed and no view, but very clean with nice and clean bathroom. Breakfast is excellent with cereals, yogurt, eggs, croissants and different types of breads. The staff is ok, Spanish people tend to be rude on the way they speak but they solve all my requests and even offered an excellent transfer service back to the airport for EUR 22, 00. There is an excellent guy at the reception, I think he is German, very nice and all smiles. They guy handling the breakfast is quite military, you cannot choose your table, upon arrival they point out the table and you must take it, very funny! For those looking for location, good rate and aware of what a three star hotel is the Regente is an excellent choice for touring the city. I certainly will be back on my next stopover in Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Chris0007
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last time in Madrid (2004) so knew location good and all local places of interest nearby. 2 mins from Gran Via Metro. Used Metro to get from T1 Airport to here. You will need to change lines twice but it's so easy - message me for details.HOWEVER.....if you arrive at T1 then the Metro is located in T2 and a good 10 min walk (if you walk fast!) so you need to allow 1 hour to get from T1 to the hotel...believe me I am a fast walker and you do so just leave planty time for return back to airport. As for hotel - excellent rooms, very clean (hotel currently under renovation) breakfast is very good. Make sure you allow plenty of time as like other reviews say the room isn't anywhere near big enough and expect to queue 10 - 15 mins or so to be seated! TRUE! Make sure the compnay you book with does give you breakfast....good as it is it ain't worth 13 Euro! Now for my only complaint....some of the staff at times very abrupt and a little ignorant although in fairness this only applied to 2! As I checked in I was ignored while he served 3 Spanish then pointed at a piece of paper with the word "sign" muttered at me! some of the staff seem to struggle if they have to do more than 2 things. BUT.....at 2am on my last night I had a prob with my safe....it got locked and wouldn't open. The night receptionist was str8 to the room to sort...very helpful chap.Yes I'd def stay here again. Reccomend!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BaracudaJones
Reviews.Content: The hotel was 2 minutes from the metro, which after a long day of traveling made the last few steps stressless. Check in was fine and easy, and they understood good english. Leading up to the room through the corridors, everything was stylish and everything i had expected from a 3 star hotel in the centre of madrid. The room was large, air conditioned and the bathroom was good sized, the beds could have been a bit more softer, but thats my personal choice. Everything is in walking distance from the hotel and being so close to the metro, you could visit any of the many attractions within 20-30 minutes. Staff friendly and helpful, one morning we did suffer with cold water in the shower, but this was dealt with fast and effectively so no bad words against them. Would recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Madrid and to enjoy what this great city has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: bowky
Reviews.Content: Could not fault the location and standard for 3 star it 'says what it does on the tin'. Good selection of breakfst items, however you may have to queue for a very short while as the dining area is not big enough to cater for the size of rooms the hotel has. Shower a little out dated but rooms very clean and decent for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, within walking....”
Reviews.Author: brn2fsh
Reviews.Content: distance of the Prado,Museo Real, and several other attractions. Just a block from Metro stations, a nice plaza and several good cafe's. Staff was friendly,helpfull and spoke English. The breakfast is very good with eggs,bacon,sausages ,fresh baked goods, sliced meat and cheese,fruit,cereals,yougart and great coffee. The little cafe right next door is excellant and a great place to hang out in the early evening. would recommend this hotel to anyone on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mrlolo096
Reviews.Content: i went to this hotel with my friend and the first thing that we remarked was that the lobby was so small, we had to wait outside sometime because there were people there, other than that the rooms are sooo awesome, me and my friends liked them so much plus the location of the hotel is really nice, its near a big avenue of shopping, which was great because spent the whole time shopping during the trip. the hotel has an awesome bar but about the service im not really sure because we didnt spend much time in the hotel. in conclusion, i would say that for a 3-star hotel it's worth staying.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, clean rooms and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: RetiredNYC
Reviews.Content: Our room was comfortable & clean; bathroom was large. There is no dry-cleaning/washers on-site. No A/C until June unless it gets very hot before then. You can walk everywhere, the bus stops at the hotel, train up one block and taxis plentiful on Gran Via.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad service, small room, charge for internet”
Reviews.Author: JoseSola
Reviews.Content: The good thing about this hotel is the location. Just a minutes away from Puerta del Sol. We stayed two times. When arriving to Madrid, and the day before leaving. The first time was not so nice. The room was too small and old. The room was so noisy. I was taking a bath when someone open the door without knocking first. The TV sets are old and so small that you cannot see from bed. Second stay room was better than first one. At least less noise and a bigger room. The breakfast was excelent. Front Desk service is not nice. The Internet is not free. I payed 2 euros for 30 minutes or 10 euros for 24 hours. This is not a three stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: prague69Wales
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in central location. Staff very friendly. Very clean with towels and bed linen changed daily. Bar needs to stay open later Dining room should try to sit friends together at breakfast also one should not have to queue for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Not much better than a hostal!”
Reviews.Author: DougieMcKerrell
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in February 2011 with my wife and son. What I would say was good about this hotel is: (1) the location is very central; (2) the buffet breakfast is good; and, (3) it was good value at 290 euros for five nights. The down side was: (1) it can be noisey at night from people and traffic in the nearby streets, this includes vehicles sounding horns in the narrow side streets; (2) there is no fridge/mini bar or tea-making facilities - a big issue if you're a tea drinker as the tea in the nearby coffee shops is awful and costs about 1.80 euros per cup; (3) the TV is a small portable set with only two english language channels, BBC World and CNN; (4) the rooms are a bit dated with old tiling and flooring throughout; and, (5) internet use is charged at 2 euros for 30 minutes - there are nearby shops that charge about 1.50 euros per hour.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: ruth_p89
Reviews.Content: Brought my boyfriend to Madrid as a gift for his birthday and stayed in the Hotel Regente for 4 nights- when we arrived we brought to a room which was so small that i could barely walk around the bed - there was shop shutters on the window that would only go half up and the bathroom was the size of a small wardrobe even though the image on the hotel website was of a nice room. luckily i had printed an image of the room on the website with me and i went down to reception and said i wanted to be put in the room that was on the website. we were then told the only other room available had 2 singles rather than a double bed but it couldnt have been any worse than the room we were in! the 2nd room was decorated better and was slightly more spacious. except for the fact that it was right next door to the cleaning ladies room so we were woken up every morning between 5am and 9am listening to banging and shouting! biggest waste of money ever, madrid was a beautiful city - i just wish i had spent an extra bit of money on a better place to stay - i hated the hotel - couldnt wait to get home for a decent sleep! definately go to Madrid - just avoid this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: rlgm007
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for new years eve because it was the only moderately priced hotel left in the Puerta Del Sol area. The first room reeked of cigarette smoke and when I opened the window to ventilate the room, all the exhaust pipes from the kitchens below vented into my room (Rm 401). I complained but with a full hotel the manager could only apologize and promise to move me the next day. My second room (Rm406) was much larger and nicer with an exterior view. I did like the buffet breakfast with plenty of options to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “I was stoled at the reception (hall) and they refused to help me or call the police”
Reviews.Author: MMMMMM_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not bad and it´s very well located. I was stoled inside the hotel, at the reception. All my docs, money, phones were gone. They ignore when I asked for help and refused to call the police. They just ignore me. I had a plane in 2 hours and I had nothing!!! Very bad attitude from all the personel!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: The_traveling_gypsy
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location - it is just off the main road through Madrid, very close to metro stations, easy to find and near lots of bars and restrauants. It was very comfortable - the beds were good, the room and bathroom was clean, we had a lovely huge shower and the air con was fantastic. There was no bar fridge in our room. Staff were friendly, we communicated in English and they were helpful with directions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good for the price!”
Reviews.Author: AventuraBird
Reviews.Content: Not too friendly front desk staff, but for the price and location, very good option. Good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value and well positioned City Centre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnW1066
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in early September. Hotel is on the Gran Via, the main shopping strret in Madrid so is well placed for all the major sites, all of which are in walkable distance. Hotel has 10 floors and some of the rooms face the street while others are at the back. Our room was on the forth floor at the back so was quite dark. We had to put the light on whatever time of the day. This also meant we had to close the curtains because at the back of the hotel the rooms faced each other so we could see into other rooms (and others look into ours). However the room was clean and comfortable. We had breakfast included and this consisted of both hot food (eggs, bacon, sausages etc) as well as cold meats and pastries etc. The breakfast room was reasonably small and got quite busy. Hotel is well positioned and easy to walk to shops and all main tourist sites. One thing we did notice about Madrid and this is mentioned in other hotel reviews - as you walk along the Gran Via and go down streets towards the centre there are quite a few prostitutes on the streets. However they are not threatening in any way and the area doesn't seem sleezy. The centre of Madrid feels safe and there are plenty of Police present. Overall I would say this hotel offers good value and is well positioned in the centre.

Reviews.Title: “You get more than what You EXPECT!”
Reviews.Author: DBUZZER
Reviews.Content: I Stayed at the Hotel Regente For 5 nights. Upon Entering the hotel it felt cozy as it has a small reception and a small Bar. The Hotel has very very friendly staff and a helpful Team. I Was Dissapointed because the Hotel Bar closes at 23:30 because In Madrid daylight ends at about 22:00. The Hotel has good lifts and easy to handle baggages. The hotel boats of luxury and for a 3 star i didn't excpect That It Has Spacious Corridors and makes you feel like home Bedrooms are a little bit un-spacious but good and modern for a 3***, and a bathroom which comprised in a shower. Breakfast was good and you'll find Like normal hotels, but has a small Restaurant. Infact I Enjoyed for the price we paid

Reviews.Title: “Omg talk about sweating!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: maria_rivera
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was in a great area,very centrally located and right next to all the shops and restaurants!!!LOcation,location,location next to all the shopping and tapa bars!!!!Great place for students.Ok, now let us talk about the rooms, The air conditioning didn't work at all!!!!the rooms where a bit small for 3 people.the bathrooms uffff they need work and lets not talk about the heat .I couldn't sleep at all.The bed was hard,small!!!They need a new cleaning staff and new airconditioning.My sister was staying in an other room and it felt like a sauna!!!! If you just need a place to crash this is the place for you.its cheap and in a great location but the rooms were horrible!!!!you can find a better hotel in the same area for the same price!!!!Hotel staff were great...

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the road”
Reviews.Author: tartedemaca
Reviews.Content: 'Average' is the world that best suits this hotel. The excellent location (just off Madrid's main shopping street) is, by far, this hotel's most valuable feature. Other than that, everything else is average: the rooms, the cleanliness and the staff's amability. Thumbs down to the humongous room keys provided at the reception. The shower was fine, but the bathroom could be slightly larger for a double room. I can't judge the breakfast service since I'm not a hotel breakfast buff. A 2 euro trip will take you from the airport to the hotel and vice-versa. The downside is you need to transfer a couple of times, so make sure you keep your eyes and ears opened to know exactly when/where to leave (there will be times on the journey the metro's voiceoff won't call the station by name and the subway is usually poorly signed). We got to Madrid quite early (10am)and the staff was kind enough to provide us with a room before the pre-scheduled time (12pm). The room can be noisy since its not soundproof and the hotel is located just off the Gran Via so be aware. If possible, ask for a room away from the lift. The room safe wasn't working properly and I could use a larger table. Overall this hotel is a fair deal and good for the money, specially if you're not a picky customer.

Reviews.Title: “Fine location at a great price but an experience marred by the staff”
Reviews.Author: WelltravelledSpain
Reviews.Content: It is in a great location. The price is good. The rooms are small but clean and the bed comfortable. The bathroom was a bit tired but OK. The breakfast is bad - very poor quality items - warm tasteless orange juice (no others on offer), horrible cooked stuff and no fresh fruit. The staff though are the worst thing - unhelpful, rude, sour - evrything is too much trouble - this is an unhappy hotel. They charge for the safe which is ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “not nice”
Reviews.Author: verso67
Reviews.Content: The hotel has stairs at the entrance and it is very difficult to carry the luggage. The hotel personnel (except for the gentleman who helps with luggage) are really UNFRIENDLY, specially the one t the breakfast room. They really give you the feeling you are begging for the service instead of paying for it. I will never recommend this hotel and will select another hotel for business trip. On the 3 days I stayed there, there were also a group of students/teen-agers that arrived every night at 1am and continue making noise till 2:30am. Cheap hotel = cheap service (again: except for the friendly gentleman (Paco) who helps with the luggage)

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but centered”
Reviews.Author: Steven1111
Reviews.Content: I wanted to comment this hotel because it is cheap for who's looking to be in the center of Madrid without leaving his panties behind! It cost me just $94 per night (found it in lastminutetravel.com site) and I was amazed to find a warm place, nice bedroom and fine breakfast. I loved the urban landscape from my window. I think the value for your money would be in places like this if you don't wanna spent all your money just to find a place to sleep. Go see the palace nearby, it's beautiful. When I was there, some royal ceremony took place inside.

Reviews.Title: “Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChilliMumbai
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, but all rooms are not good. Centrally located, with Indian Restaurant nearby

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, clean & spacious rooms.”
Reviews.Author: totomitsy
Reviews.Content: Located just off Gran Via the main street of Madrid, with a variety of Restaurants, Cafes and shopping. Rooms are spacious, clean and tidy. We did not have breakfast at the hotel, but there is a large selection on Gran via, so take advantage and indulge in the local restaurants. As in Madrid, it is very close to various train stations for easy travel. We took a shuttle service from the airport which was the most cost effective way in both directions. If we visit Madrid again, we will definitely stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice room”
Reviews.Author: maribel00198
Reviews.Content: We got to Madrid early so we had to wait for a room to be available, but it was well worth it since we got the corner on the 3rd floor with the best view of La Gran Via. I wish we had better directions on how to get there by train, since it is close to the Sol Station and the Taxi was espensive. It is walking distance to many atractions and next to El Corte Ingles. Service was OK, with exception of the guy that takes care of the luggage, no one was overly friendly, but then again...that is the way they are in Spain.

Reviews.Title: “top hotel”
Reviews.Author: blooby
Reviews.Content: stayed at the regente hotel in madrid great location good quality hotel vey good cooked breakfast will keep you going most of the day nice clean rooms comfortable beds checking in staff a little distant take a stick with a feather on it nothing to worry about really get down for breakfast before 9.15 can get a little busy after that can recommend this hotel if I wanted to be a bit picky booked a wake up call on the tv in the room was charged 2euro when checking out first time a hotel charged for a call

Reviews.Title: “Slap Bang in the Centre”
Reviews.Author: NZKRONKY
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Regente a few times and I am going again next week I can't wait. I don't understand what people are complaining about, I have always found it to be clean and the staff are very helpful they don't speak fluent english but how can we brits criticise that! Anyway I quite like that I am forced to use my terrible spanish that's half the fun! The breakfast is a bit dull but the location is amazing you can go and get breakfast anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, unhelpful staff, terrible breakfast”
Reviews.Author: iriskasiriskas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are in our late 20s/ early 30s, and we feel that this place has only its location going for it. The staff, everyone of them, were not helpful, when I asked them if they can call to confirm my tour one day, they showed me to pay phone an said "or you can use a phone in your room". I don't speak Spanish and it would have been helpful if they helped me with that. But i guess it was too much to ask to confirm my tour departure time. Any other issues--they were not helpful either. My husband and I ended up going to Best western next door, every day, to ask for a map with directions! Also, during the breakfast, I asked if I could fill my 20 oz water bottle with water, they said no! I said it's just water and I have a small bottle, they rudely said "it's not possible". The breakfast itself, was the worst ever, my husband and I were traveling from North to south of spain and stayed in several hotels, but this was by far the worst breakfast and hotel of all. Please be advised.

Reviews.Title: “The Regente ticked all the right boxes ...”
Reviews.Author: CarinaB
Reviews.Content: Despite some apprehension due to some negative reviews, we were delighted with The Regente. Firstly, the staff - if you make an effort to speak a few words of Spanish & smile - then they are extremely helpful - 'simples'! In the heat of August, it is definitely an advantage to have an inside facing room - quiet & cool. Cleanliness could not be faulted - or the standard of breakfast - there was a massive choice - Sunday morning was a tad hectic, but everyone likes to sleep in on a Sunday. The location is fantastic - getting to the hotel from the airport is easy - 2 Euros on the metro (which is clean & has a/c!) takes you to either Callao or Gran Via - again - 'simples'. Muchas gracias ....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, clean and modern rooms but not soundproofed”
Reviews.Author: BeckyColley
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel using online around an hour before we arrived and when we got to the hotel we had some problems checking-in as they had not yet received our booking. I'm not sure whether the problem was their system or that of the website we used to book, however we thought that the staff were quite rude (we almost felt as if they were accusing us of making up a booking to try to get a free room!). It took around 15 minutes to sort out however we eventually were given our room and were very pleased. It was modern, comfortable, very clean, spacious and the bathroom was lovely; the shower was incredible! The only problem was that the room was not soundproofed. I was woken several times during the one night we stayed there: there were lots of people slamming doors, talking outside our room (even though we were only on a corner and not in a particularly busy place e.g. near the lift), and at 7am I was even woken when I could hear someone else's phone ringing with their wake-up call. The hotel was nice and I would stay again but I would ask for a room at the end of a corridor to minimise noise.

Reviews.Title: “Really Not All That Bad!!!”
Reviews.Author: gazza353
Reviews.Content: I must admit that after reading some of the reviews on here before travelling, I was a little bit nervous of what to expect when I arrived at the Regente. However, I was pleasantly surprised. We got there at 10:30 a.m. but were given the key to the room straight away (we had expected to have to wait until 12:00 p.m. at the earliest). The room itself was fine - clean, light and with the added bonus of a balcony. The maids came every day to clean, change towels etc.. so no problems there. Yes, there is some noise from the street but if you are staying in a hotel that is a stone's throw away from the busiest road in Madrid (the Gran Via), well, what do you really expect?!? We did the buffet breakfast once during our stay and it was pretty standard stuff - eggs, meats, pastries, fruit, yoghurts etc. Generally the staff were okay - after living in Spain for 2 years now, I know that 'customer service' is not that big over here, so don't expect to be met by beaming smiles each time you drop off or pick up your room key!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay at the Regente”
Reviews.Author: DanielleMS
Reviews.Content: The Location for The Regente may be one of the best (right on the Grand Via) but the standards of the hotel leave alot to be desired.... The toilets are brutal. You can't swing a cat (or so to speak) and they are not very clean. The tv does not have satellite. There are hookers outside There is alot of noise as this is one of the busiest streets. You will be woken up various times. The receptionists are rude.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it!!!”
Reviews.Author: missheathergreen
Reviews.Content: Out of four hotels we stayed at throughout Spain, this was the WORST one. The interior of the rooms is disguisting. We walked into our room and it smelled like a mix of cigarettes and [----]! I could hear everything going on in the other rooms and hallways through the paper thin walls. The breakfast was gross, the pastries were all dry and the eggs tasted like rubber. The front desk personell were the most UNFRIENDLY people we met in Spain. They ignore you, barely help you with directions and tried to charge us 10 euro to use the computer for 30 minutes until I yelled at them and it seemed the guy was 5 seconds from slapping me. Do not stay at this hotel! There are so many other hotels in close proximity that I'm sure are 100 times better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location, interior disappointing”
Reviews.Author: feebee80
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an ideal base for exploring all the main attractions of Madrid. We were a bit disappointed with the standard of the rooms, quite small, shabby furniture, small tv with limited channels, not great for a city centre hotel. The lobby and hallway areas appeared more plush, so perhaps a renovation/upgrade is under way. The room was clean enough when we arrived however we didnt get the maid during our 2 night stay so no clean towels. Staff a little grumpy, but that was a common theme even with waiters at the restaurants/cafes we went to, we presumed it was a Madridian trait! Although the location was great, the metro could be used to get you anywhere from another hotel, so we probably wouldnt recommend to a friend. We did find a really great local bar round the corner, so if you are going to the Regente, turn right out the door, first left , left again and the small place is on your left - lovely free tapas with your drinks - we went twice.

Reviews.Title: “Great at the right price”
Reviews.Author: Blossom55
Reviews.Content: Clean,comfortable no-frills accommoation, brilliant location, and for us at a great price. We did not partake of the in-house breakfast. Reception staff, though not oerly warm, id do their job effectively. Also houkeeping staff, much more friendly, did an effecive job. No complains about this basic, clean, cost-effective accommodation situated in a quiet street just off he Grand Via. Others have commented about the walls being paper thin. We did not really encounter this problem until our lat night, when we had neghburs. These particulr neihbours chose to yell a lot & slam their doors. We heard them.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: JulieHFM
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very simple. Location was OK and staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel but great location”
Reviews.Author: Dee_202
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my boyfriend in October for 4 nights and found it just ok. Firstly the location is great, right behind Gran Via and just a short walk to the main shopping areas and nightlife. Excellent location. There a couple of things that put me off the hotel - top of the list is the staff. They have to be the worst I've ever come across in any hotel I've stayed in - incredibly rude and unfriendly and not one bit helpful. One night I made the mistake of asking them for help in finding a restaurant which had been recommended to us . I had the address written down and tried to show it to the guy behind the reception desk. He didn't even look at the address, just gave me a surly look and said I don't know. There were other incidents but I won't go on - just suffice to say that the manners of the staff in this hotel leave a lot to be desired!. Others have said that its a language barrier but in my experience they were well able to speak English when it suited them!. The other issue I had was the rooms are absolutely tiny. Enough room for the furniture and not much else. Not even room for your suitcase without falling over it every time you went to the bathroom!. The hotel can be very noisy also - you can even hear people going to the loo and showering in the other rooms!. We could also hear the maids hoovering the corridor in the mornings and it actually felt like they were in the room with us at times as the noise was so loud! We were woken up on a few occasions very early in the morning which was quite annoying. Other than that, overall its an ok hotel for a couple of days. Though if I was going back to Madrid I don't think I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A couple of issues!”
Reviews.Author: LUSKJU
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent, the room was an OK size for a European hotel, the buffet breakfast (included in our rate) was fine and everything was very clean. We did not hear the room to room noise that others have mentioned. However, the front desk staff were not at all friendly - although this might have been their lack of English which is as much our problem as theirs, we don't speak Spanish! The internet was not working after we had paid for some time but our money was refunded no problem. Our big issue was the air conditioning, Before booking we had checked that the room would have air conditioning as we knew that the location was noisy and we probably wouldn't be able to sleep if we had the window open - our room was directly over the Gran Via! - .After the first night when we tried to get some air, we went to the desk to find out what the problem was and were told, without any apology, that the air conditioning was not in operation after October 1st. It was 26degrees in Madrid .! We would recommend the Regente but only during cold winter months or when you are sure the air conditioning is working!

Reviews.Title: “Position, Position, Position”
Reviews.Author: kathyMazarron
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights during October. The position is great, close to the best bars in Madrid. Walking distance of the major sights & amongst the shopping area. Check-in was simple & easy, our room was fine, a bit small but it had everything we wanted for a city break. The room faced a side street off of Gran Via. The windows are not double glazed so there is some traffic noise. We were woken in the early hours by some revellers chatting noisily outside, but unless you are a very light sleeper you shouldn’t find it too bad. For us, it was a perfect hotel for a busy city break.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and decent price”
Reviews.Author: boltonspacers
Reviews.Content: Myself and 2 friends satyed here in Feb 08 for a short trip to Madrid. We travelled from Valencia to Madrid by car and had no problems in finding the hotel. Though parking is another issue!!! Though thats our own fault, ended up paying around £30 to park for two days at a nearby carpark as the hotel doesn't have any parking. Though i can't really hold that against the hotel. We shared a triple room, and it was much better than we imagined considering the price. Out of season granted but it worked out less than £30 each for the room per night. We had ourselves a nice panaromic balcony that had a great view over the Gran Via. The room was of a good sized and had a decent sized bathroom. For 3 likely lads it was way more than adequate. Only downsides were that breakfast wasn't included and they were wanted silly prices for it pay on day, also the front desk weren't exactly the friendliest but that was no biggie. Overall though, based on its fantastic location and decent price this place would be well worth considering for a short stay in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Value for Money, Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrotterFromRio
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight at the Regente, and couldn't be happier with the room, friendly staff, excellent location (just off the Gran Via) and the great buffet breakfast. What a positive surprise!Greatly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “typical 3* european hotel, great location....”
Reviews.Author: rk99
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location, right off Gran Via, between Gran Via and Callao metro stops (Callao is closer) - either way two transfers from the airport. The location of the hotel is perfect is you like to party. There are plenty of bars and discos nearby and the Chueca district is only 5 mins away. There are also a lot of great stores nearby. Stayed 5 nights. We had a 'double' room which had two twin beds pushed together. They were pretty comfortable, but short, so my feet were hanging off the end of the bed (and I'm only 5'11)! The room itself was a good size and clean. I guess my only real complaint is that the walls were pretty thin and you could hear a lot of noise from slamming doors and furniture being dragged on parquet floors in the morning. I honestly think the maids were doing it on purpose to make sure all rooms were vacated and cleaned by noon!! It was quite annoying. So if you like to sleep in in the morning, I'd find a different hotel. Breakfast was included with our room rate. Typical hotel breakfast: scrambled eggs, bacon, beans, some cereals, yogurts, breads and pastries, orange or pineapple juices, coffee, tea. The selection wasn't bad, but it was the exact same thing every morning. Overall, a good hotel in a GREAT location. But I probably wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Joanne055
Reviews.Content: 5 of us have just come back from a 2 night stay at the Regente Hotel where we were staying in 2 rooms (both had two twin beds pushed together and an extra sofa bed) This hotel was in a good location just off Gran Via, 2 mins from the metro and just a few minutes walk to Sol. We arrived to check in at midday and even though early we were shown to our room straight away. The staff on the desk were helpful and helped us with various queries we had. Rooms were clean and breakfast decent enough and with the added bonus of it being served till 10.30am which is ideal following a late night! Having read previous comments about the noise I was expecting to hear the hustle and bustle of the city but we were put in the inner rooms where there was not a hint of outside noise . Although the walls were really thin so there was noise from other rooms which could be quite annoying. Only other negative comments is the rooms weren't clean by the maid during our stay. All in a decent hotel. Not luxury but clean and tidy place in a goodlocation and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: risermon
Reviews.Content: A good value at less than EU 100, located right in the heart of Madrid. Room was clean, but small and very noisy at night. Window was right next to a major street, Gran Via, which was hopping with loud voices and ambulances half the night. Great view from the balcony, though. Would recommend internal room, if you are sensitive to loud noise. Hotel staff was friendly and professional. Were willing to book Flamenco reservations for us at a small lesser known venue, that took some time for them to look up. Good house keeping service. Close to all kinds of restaurants and coffee/pastry shops. Hotel breakfast buffet looked good, but didn't try.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: MulberrySt
Reviews.Content: I have returned from a three night stay at the Hotel Regente, Madrid. The hotel is located immediately off the Gran Via , within a couple of minutes' walk of Sol, and to our mind you'd find it hard to beat. We took a 'red-eye' flight for the bank holiday weekend, but were immediately checked in (around 10am) and given our room; which was clean and adequately equipped; it also had a balcony. Breakfast was provided for the duration of the stay, and you can avail of it until 10.30am. Madrid is a great party town and this hotel is situated near all the action. There is excellent shopping nearby and you'll find lovely places to eat. Viva Espana!

Reviews.Title: “Great Position & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: curryking
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended the Regente to me several years ago I had come to Madrid for a wedding & everyone was staying in a very expensive chic hotel in a smart part of town but I stayed at the Regente. I was told to book an inside room (the ones with very little light) because they are quiet. I loved it the area is brilliant, just of the Gran Via minutes from a metro stop & 10 mins from the beautiful Plaza Mayor. They have been gradually redecorating the hotel floor by floor & when I stayed last week the 3rd floor was just finished. The rooms are very ordinary but spotless & the staff are so friendly & helpful & I love the fact that most people staying there are Spanish. I stayed for 2 days & had an inside room which was very quiet & then visited Salamanca & when I returned on Saturday night had to have an outside room AND opposite the lifts(elevators) It was terrible I hard hardly any sleep. The Old Town is manic on a saturday night so crowded & so noisy & it's fun but if you don't want to go to bed at 4am make sure that you get an inside room. Low numbers 1 -6 are by the lift & outside teens are inside. The restaurants in the area are dreadful there's an Italian called Gino's in Calle Arenal which is ok but small & gets full very quickly. Avoid Zahara across the road it's truly terrible

Reviews.Title: “the good....bad,,,augly”
Reviews.Author: mechil
Reviews.Content: i stay at regente 10 days the good things about hotel: location was excellent ,plaza de sol 3min. walk, royal palace 10min. ,retiro park 15 min. walk ,prado musume 10min. plaza mayor 7min walk. the room was clean ,medium size, nice view on gran via,breakfast was very good. room price was very cheap.a/c was fine. the bad things about hotel: you can hear pepole steps when walking outside your room due to woody floor that makes crampling sound especialy after mid night.lobby was very small.no coffe facillity in the room. the ugly things about hotel:safe in the room is subcharched (not advertised). internet was not working. hotel not making tourist trips as it is advertised. staff not speak english very well. after all it was ok for pepole looking for good location , clean and cheap rooms . would i be back to this hotel? not sure about that.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: msnmsn
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in late June. We really liked the hotel - spotless, comfortable, GREAT location. The desk staff were somewhat distant (would not make a phone call to a late night pharmacy; just told me to walk there). I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine.”
Reviews.Author: AliceGr
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. It is adjacent to one of our favorite restaurant/outdoor cafes in Madrid. The room was not special, but it was clean and quiet. Service was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: JAXtravel
Reviews.Content: Wow! This place must be Madrid's best kept secret! First of all, the location IS TO DIE FOR!! It's a 1 minute walk to ALL the best shopping, 5 minute walk to your choice of 2 metro stations, and about 1000 restaurantes, bars, and cafe's! In fact, try the little bar behind the hotel it's completly perfect. I consider myself a very discriminating guest, and this hotel past all the test! Despite other reviews, the Regente was very comfortable, good room size, nice lobby with very friendly staff, and suprisingly very quiet! Trust me, give this place a chance, you WILL NOT be dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: caz363er
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner and my 7 years old daughter stayed here for 5 nights the first week of June, the hotel was OK, We ended up on the 3rd Floor at the back of the hotel with no natural light coming into our room at all. When I got up every morning I had to open the window and look up to the sky to see what the weather was like - It always felt like night time in our room, We also specifically requested a double and single bed in our room but ended up with 3 single beds which were all stuck together. the rooms were cleaned spotless everyday, Breakfast was really good also, Loads of choices and plenty for everyone. Reception staff were not as helpful as I had anticipated- they could not recommend a nice restaurant for a birthday treat for my partner or book any flamenco show for us. when asked about bullfighting they just shrugged and said it will be all booked out by now - they showed no effort to help, Madrid It self was great and five nights were definetly enough for a city break, We visited the Faunia Science park which is a 20 minute walk from its nearest metro, It cost us €22.00 each to get in and it was not that great so i would not reccommed it, We visited the Zoo and spent a whole day there- it was great - we saw a bird show , sea lion show and to top it all off we saw a dolphin show which was excellent. the zoo is close to its nearest metro station. We also visited the theme park near the zoo on the Monday before we were returning home and I can honeslty say it was the best day out I have had in a long time, It cost €26 per adult and €16 per child and you could go on everything in the park for that No Ques at all onthe monday, - It has a great kids area also and the food in the park is very reasonalbe, On our last night in madrid we went to a hotel ( Hotel Doscastillas) across from the regent and It was the worst meal and experience that we had in madrid. they mixed up our order and i ordered steak well done and i got Steak Tartar and felt like I was on Fear factor trying to eat it, My partner ordered Veal for started and Sole for main course, The gave him the veal but gave our daughter the sole and we taught that we had also just ordered the sole for or daughter but in fact they gave her her daddys dinner and when we tried to explain it was just not worth the effort cause they just shrugged their shoulders and walked away, We ended up paying €110.00 for a meal that was disgusting and just left a bad feeling for our whole trip to madris, Overall the hotel is OK - good for shopping, great location to the metro stations and my only bit of advise for someone that likes to eat what they order is to go to McDonalds.

Reviews.Title: “would return”
Reviews.Author: innaMontreal
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Regente May 20-22, 2007. Thanks to the great location of this clean, well run hotel, not a moment of our short stay was wasted. We had a room on the 4th floor, no problem with noise. Really liked the breakfast (from 7:30AM), everything fresh, rolls and all. Two level city tour bus stops close by, very convenient if you're pressed for time like we were. Regente hotel is quite attractive and is surrounded by beautiful buildings and all kinds of restaurants (for every budget). Many of the main cites are easily accessible by foot. Lot's of shops, Il Court Ingles, a lovely department store two minutes away. Madrid is gorgeous, would love to return for a longer stay and at the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: missprim
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel at the end of March. Fantastic location and good value for money. Room was clean and facing the main road so a little noise was experienced but it wasn't a problem. Room was on the small side but it did not matter to us. The reception staff, mainly men, were not at all helpful and quite unapproachable. Would stay here again though for location and price. Give it a go!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: GG1974
Reviews.Content: We loved the Regente. We stayed there for 2 nights in November 2006 and would definitely go back. As the hotel is located right on the Gran Via its a perfect location to explore Madrid (especially if you are only there for a short time). From the airport, catch the Metro (you will need to change lines a couple of times but its cheap and fast). The Regente is a 5 minute walk from the Gran Via metro station. We did room only but (as another poster has observed) the cafe across the road (Zahara) is perfect for breakfast - there are also plenty of other options nearby. The hotel is clean and the staff are very friendly. Please do expect traffic noise at night - Madrid is a 24 hour city and if you don’t want to have to put up with 24 hour traffic maybe you shouldn’t be looking for a city break?! I would recommend you ask for a room further up - we were on the 7th floor and the were conscious of the noise but it didn’t stop us sleeping. Madrid is a wonderful city and if I get the chance to go back I would stay at the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: Boybeck
Reviews.Content: We got a really good deal for this hotel, it was £150 for three nights from [----]. The first room offered was very dark and dingy so we asked for a different room. The second room was much lighter although a little small. The bed was very comfortable and soft. If you are a heavy sleeper then this hotel would not cause you any problems. However, if you are a light sleeper you may struggle to get a good night's sleep here because of the road noise. The hotel is in a great location, just a few metres away from the main shopping thoroughfare of Gran Via. Breakfast was good value for money (it was included in our room price). This is a good value mid range hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Joeri
Reviews.Content: I stayed for five days in Hotel Regente for a business trip. I stayed in a single room and, although the room was on the tiny side, it gave me all comfort I needed. The room was very clean and kept very clean during my journey. Also fresh towels every day. Breakfast was very good, with a wide variety of choices: eggs, bacon, sausages, beans but also bread, butter, cheese, ham, chorizo. The only thing I missed was some fresh fruit. One drawback: the staff. They were not really friendly nor helpfull and spoke very little or no english at all...but this is an issue almost everywhere in Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TinaSheffield
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one night stay with my daughter. The hotel was extremely clean and the staff courteous. It was very warm in the room as stated in another review. Had I read this first I would have requested an exterior room. However as we were only staying one night the interior room didn't spoil our stay. It was comfortable with plenty of hot water. Good breakfast which was included in our booking price otherwise it's not worth paying the 9 euros extra as there are so many eateries close by. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A clean, well situated mid-range hotel”
Reviews.Author: Quentin1
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Regente is a pretty standard 3-star Spanish hotel. Double rooms are a good size and in terms of square footage and amenities are equivalent to those found in other 3-star hotels in this country, both in the capital and elsewhere (and believe me, I've stayed in plenty of Spanish hotels!). Some of the singles, however, are very small indeed (vide the unhappy American whose review also appears on this site), and many of the rooms are what the Spaniards call 'interior', i.e. they look onto a dark and dingy lightwell. When making a reservation guests should therefore ensure that they make a specific request for an outside room ('exterior'), and singles should book a double for single use. The cost of this is rarely very little more than the price of a single (but the rate doesn't usually show up on either the hotel's website nor anybody else's as it's not good business to sell a double for single use at a lower tariff!). The hotel does have a number of double-bedded rooms (as opposed to twins) and again guests should make a specific request for this sort of accommodation (although my request for a double is often overlooked as there are very few rooms of this sort). The rooms are also furnished in a pretty standard manner -- wood floors throughout (with tile in the bathroom), and simple furniture in dark wood of the type so beloved of the Spanish. Bathrooms in double rooms all have a bath, basin, toilet and bidet, although the singles don't usually feature the latter and have a shower instead of a bath. A/C is controlled by a thermostat and dial combo in each room (except for some of the singles on the top floor) and the accommodation is pleasantly cool in summer. During the freezing Madrid winters the central heating is ramped up to the maximum, and it is likely guests would have to turn off at least one of the radiators in their rooms to avoid asphixiating. Bathrooms, rooms, and all public areas are spotlessly clean. I stay at this hotel several times a year while visiting Madrid for professional purposes and I have never, ever come across so much as a speck of dirt. In true Spanish fashion the bathrooms are always bleached so thoroughly that any microbe would be dead on impact. Indeed, so clean are these bathrooms that you could probably eat your lunch from the floor. The property is very well situated for all manner of amenities -- shopping, sightseeing, eating, drinking, etc. This is a fairly straightforward 3-star Spanish hotel that has the advantages of being very clean (although most Spanish hotels are), very central, very safe, and boasts an extremely friendly and helpful staff (and how many places in Spain can boast that?!). Having stayed here on a regular basis for the past many years, however, I can appreciate the comments of some contributors to this forum who state that the interior is a little tired. A full revamp would be a good idea, but until that's done, don't be put off staying here -- provided, of course, you're not a fussy Yank who expects a jacuzzi in the room, a private butler, and obsequious service from all and sundry. You aren't going to get any of that!

Reviews.Title: “Same view, different town....”
Reviews.Author: Frances-in-France
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Regente from 19-22May. The Hotel was excellent. High stanadard of cleanliness, comfortable bed, wide choice for breakfast from the buffet. Very well placed for sightseeing,( the open top bus just across the road,) and the Metro just down the road. Our view from our window was a bit disappointing, although exactly what I've experienced in Paris, New York and the Savoy in London....namely a fire escape and rear windows of other buildings and a small patch of sky. However as we always spend more time out of the room than in it we didn't mind too much. About pickpockets, this time we were lucky, probably due to a heightened awareness. On his first visit to Madrid my husband had his wallet and credit cards stolen on the Metro going to his hotel. Then 3 days later, while sitting alone at a Pavement café o on the Gran Via with his back to the road, his lap top computer was taken, from between his feet by someone who must have been walking at the edge of the fast moving traffic! (He didn't hear or feel anything either) His tickets, passport and the Police document reporting the first theft went with it! BE WARNED stealing from tourists is a national sport in Spain, especially in Barcelona or even in remote beauty spots. Do not respond if someone is indicating that you may have a problem with your car....(Even if they do look like policemen! ) .I could fill a book with sad traveller's tales which start with " He waved us down, pointing at our wheels......"

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fab!!”
Reviews.Author: JodieBath
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 5 day break in Madrid It is the second time that I have been there (went for a shorter break last year) however the first time that I have stayed in the Hotel Regente. I can honestly say that I could not find fault with it whatsoever. The room (triple sleeping 3) was extremely spacious, lovely bathroom and all cleaned to an exceptional standard. The location was perfect, a fabulous view of the entire Gran Via awaits you and it is a stones throw away from all of the shops, bars and the Vision Madrid Tour Bus Stop which I would thoroughly recommend as the most efficient way of getting around the city to see all of the most famous sights. The hotel staff are polite and friendly and the entire experience was an absolute pleasure. Would 100% reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Better then expected”
Reviews.Author: Aly58
Reviews.Content: Having read the previous reports on this hotel, we were nearly put off booking to stay here, but we decided to take a chance. My daughter and I stayed at the Regente Hotel Madrid for 3 nights. We had a twin room on the 5th floor overlooking the side street. The room was clean and tidy. I think perhaps the rooms and corridor had been refurbished recently. The staff on the Reception were helpful and we had no problems with our booking which we had booked over the internet with Alpharooms. Many of the reviews stated that noise was a problem, we did not experience this. Breakfast was included in the price, with a range of cereal, yogurt, toast, rolls, cold meats etc, the waitress was helpful and the food was replenished as needed. I would say it is a case of getting what you pay for, we paid roughly £55.00 per night, the location of the hotel was good, easily within walking distance on the main tourist areas and close to the Metro stations. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would stay at this hotel again. One problem we did encounter was pickpockets, I had my purse stolen on the Metro when we were getting from the airport to the hotel. It was stolen as I was trying to board the train, by a couple of children who followed me on to the train and then jumped back off. My handbag was zipped up and I did not fell anything. Please be aware that this can happen. Having spent 2 hours at the police station to obtain an incident report number. It is obvious that this is a problem on the Metro in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - In Need of Refurnish”
Reviews.Author: TYA180
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 nights in Madrid. The best feature of the hotel is its location, very central. The hotel looks tired and in need of refurnish. The staff were wonderful and would do anything to please you. The rooms were of a good size, we had connecting rooms for a family of five. The bathrooms suffer from lack of ventilation. At stages the room walls appeared to be very thin as we could hear the guests next door and in the hallway. Overall, expected a little bit more for a 3 star hotel, the website is not a true reflection of the state of the hotel. Would stay again only if refurnished.

Reviews.Title: “Nice 4 the Price”
Reviews.Author: travellingalone
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 4 nights over Thanksgiving. I was a female traveling alone and was able to hop on the metro straight from the Madrid airport and get off the Gran Via exit, the hotel was maybe 2 blocks if that far. It has a sign on Gran Via but, is accessed thru a side street. It was nice and clean, easy check in. When I got to my room it was a twin and small. I thought well, just going sleep and shower here, still clean and nice. As soon as I opened my suitcase the phone rang and a gentleman at the front desk said I was suppose to have a double bed and was sending someone to take my luggage and escort me to another room. Right away a man took me to a bigger room, which was clean and a little larger. I was pleased with this hotel overall. A good price (Expedia purchase) and very well kept. If any gripes it would be that my view out of the window was the outside walls of the hotel, no temperature control in room (got warm, slept with window open),extra charge to use the inroom safe, noisy hallways, the room next to mine's door was not even a foot away. When I took a bath one nite, I thought the man next door was in the tub with me when I heard him talk and cough. All in all the staff was great, shopping, restaurants,coffee shops, nearby. Close 2 site seeing, easily could walk to most (Plaza de Mayor, Palacio Real, Plaza Puerto del Sol). Felt very safe walking alone on the streets. Shooters Bar (excellent) across the street. Overall well located, clean and nice staff. If I went back to Madrid, might stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings.”
Reviews.Author: dnavaliant
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 nights in Madrid. Here are some of our thoughts on the Hotel Regente: 1. Location: Good (not great) location. Next to the Gran Via and within a 15 - 25 minute walk to all major tourist attractions. Near shops, restaurants, and metro. There were many other hotels with a better location than the Regente. 2. Room: Average room. Bed was two twins put together, which my wife did not appreciate. Rooms had incredibly thin walls. We heard absolutely everything (if you know what I mean) that happened in the room to our left, right, and above us. It was very noisy all night. Could not get a good night sleep. The bathroom was clean and a good size. 3. Overall: The room was average. The bathroom was fine. The location was fine. The price was great (50 euros per night). But I probably would not stay there again simply because of the noise at night. If I stay there it would only be because of the price. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: aussieblues
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Regente in late June. Given that this is a 3* hotel, we were pleasantly surprised by the size of the room, which was larger than some of the 4* hotels we stayed at in other cities during our trip. The rooms were clean and quiet, service was good and location was terrific, close to the metro and main shopping areas. But if you are driving then don't stay here as the parking is expensive (so are a lot of other hotels in Madrid actually). I would definitely stay here again if I'm in Madrid.
